newsitem.title: GERMANY: Dresdner branches to stay open later from November.
newsitem.headline: Dresdner branches to stay open later from November.

text.p: Germany's second-largest commercial bank, Dresdner Bank, said on Monday it will keep its branches open later in line with new laws extending shopping hours.
From the start of November, 100 branches will be open late, some until 8 p.m. Remaining branches will come into line before the end of the year.
New legislation allows shops and other businesses to open until 8 p.m. during the week and to stay open longer at weekends.
